trans-unit.source: Configure HBase replication between two datacenters | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Configure HBase replication between two datacenters | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to configure HBase replication across two data centers, and about the use cases for cluster replication.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to configure HBase replication across two data centers, and about the use cases for cluster replication.

trans-unit.source: Learn how to configure HBase replication across two data centers.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to configure HBase replication across two data centers.

trans-unit.source: Some use cases for cluster replication include:
trans-unit.target: Some use cases for cluster replication include:

trans-unit.source: Backup and disaster recovery
trans-unit.target: Backup and disaster recovery

trans-unit.source: Data aggregation
trans-unit.target: Data aggregation

trans-unit.source: Geographic data distribution
trans-unit.target: Geographic data distribution

trans-unit.source: Online data ingestion combined with offline data analytics
trans-unit.target: Online data ingestion combined with offline data analytics

trans-unit.source: Cluster replication uses a source-push methodology.
trans-unit.target: Cluster replication uses a source-push methodology.

trans-unit.source: An HBase cluster can be a source, a destination, or can fulfill both roles at once.
trans-unit.target: An HBase cluster can be a source, a destination, or can fulfill both roles at once.

trans-unit.source: Replication is asynchronous, and the goal of replication is eventual consistency.
trans-unit.target: Replication is asynchronous, and the goal of replication is eventual consistency.

trans-unit.source: When the source receives an edit to a column family with replication enabled, that edit is propagated to all destination clusters.
trans-unit.target: When the source receives an edit to a column family with replication enabled, that edit is propagated to all destination clusters.

trans-unit.source: When data is replicated from one cluster to another, the source cluster and all clusters which have already consumed the data are tracked to prevent replication loops.
trans-unit.target: When data is replicated from one cluster to another, the source cluster and all clusters which have already consumed the data are tracked to prevent replication loops.

trans-unit.source: For more information, In this tutorial, you will configure a source-destination replication.
trans-unit.target: For more information, In this tutorial, you will configure a source-destination replication.

trans-unit.source: For other cluster topologies, see [Apache HBase Reference Guide](http://hbase.apache.org/book.html#clusterreplication).
trans-unit.target: For other cluster topologies, see [Apache HBase Reference Guide](http://hbase.apache.org/book.html#clusterreplication).

trans-unit.source: This is the third part of the series:
trans-unit.target: This is the third part of the series:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure a VPN connectivity between two virtual networks[hdinsight-hbase-replication-vnet]</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure a VPN connectivity between two virtual networks[hdinsight-hbase-replication-vnet]</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure DNS for the virtual networks[hdinsight-hbase-replication-dns]</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Configure HBase geo replication (this tutorial)
trans-unit.target: Configure HBase geo replication (this tutorial)

trans-unit.source: The following diagram illustrates the two virtual networks and the network connectivity you created in <linkText>Configure a VPN connectivity between two virtual networks[hdinsight-hbase-geo-replication-vnet]</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Configure DNS for the virtual networks[hdinsight-hbase-replication-dns]</linkText><title></title>:
trans-unit.target: The following diagram illustrates the two virtual networks and the network connectivity you created in <linkText>Configure a VPN connectivity between two virtual networks[hdinsight-hbase-geo-replication-vnet]</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Configure DNS for the virtual networks[hdinsight-hbase-replication-dns]</linkText><title></title>:

trans-unit.target: <linkText>HDInsight HBase replication virtual network diagram</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: An Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: An Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Get Azure free trial</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Get Azure free trial</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: A workstation with Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: A workstation with Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Install and use Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Install and use Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To execute PowerShell scripts, you must run Azure PowerShell as administrator and set the execution policy to RemoteSigned.
trans-unit.target: To execute PowerShell scripts, you must run Azure PowerShell as administrator and set the execution policy to RemoteSigned.

trans-unit.source: See Using the Set-ExecutionPolicy cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: See Using the Set-ExecutionPolicy cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: Two Azure virtual network with VPN connectivity and with DNS configured.
trans-unit.target: Two Azure virtual network with VPN connectivity and with DNS configured.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see <linkText>Configure a VPN connection between two Azure virtual networks[hdinsight-hbase-replication-vnet]</linkText><title></title>, and <linkText>Configure DNS between two Azure virtual networks[hdinsight-hbase-replication-dns]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see <linkText>Configure a VPN connection between two Azure virtual networks[hdinsight-hbase-replication-vnet]</linkText><title></title>, and <linkText>Configure DNS between two Azure virtual networks[hdinsight-hbase-replication-dns]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Before running PowerShell scripts, make sure you are connected to your Azure subscription using the following cmdlet:
trans-unit.target: Before running PowerShell scripts, make sure you are connected to your Azure subscription using the following cmdlet:

trans-unit.source: If you have multiple Azure subscriptions, use the following cmdlet to set the current subscription:
trans-unit.target: If you have multiple Azure subscriptions, use the following cmdlet to set the current subscription:

trans-unit.source: In <linkText>Configure a VPN connection between two Azure virtual networks[hdinsight-hbase-replication-vnet]</linkText><title></title>, you have created a virtual network in an Europe data center, and a virtual network in a U.S. data center.
trans-unit.target: In <linkText>Configure a VPN connection between two Azure virtual networks[hdinsight-hbase-replication-vnet]</linkText><title></title>, you have created a virtual network in an Europe data center, and a virtual network in a U.S. data center.

trans-unit.source: The two virtual network are connected via VPN.
trans-unit.target: The two virtual network are connected via VPN.

trans-unit.source: In this session, you will provision an HBase cluster in each of the virtual networks.
trans-unit.target: In this session, you will provision an HBase cluster in each of the virtual networks.

trans-unit.source: Later in this tutorial, you will make one of the HBase clusters to replicate the other HBase cluster.
trans-unit.target: Later in this tutorial, you will make one of the HBase clusters to replicate the other HBase cluster.

trans-unit.source: The Azure portal doesn't support provisioning HDInsight clusters with custom configuration options.
trans-unit.target: The Azure portal doesn't support provisioning HDInsight clusters with custom configuration options.

trans-unit.source: For example, set hbase.replication to true.
trans-unit.target: For example, set hbase.replication to true.

trans-unit.source: If you set the value in the configuration file after a cluster is provisioned, you will lose the setting after the cluster is being reimaged.
trans-unit.target: If you set the value in the configuration file after a cluster is provisioned, you will lose the setting after the cluster is being reimaged.

trans-unit.source: For more information see <linkText>Provision Hadoop clusters in HDInsight[hdinsight-provision]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information see <linkText>Provision Hadoop clusters in HDInsight[hdinsight-provision]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: One of the options to provision HDInsight cluster with custom options is using Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: One of the options to provision HDInsight cluster with custom options is using Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: To provision an HBase Cluster in Contoso-VNet-EU
trans-unit.target: To provision an HBase Cluster in Contoso-VNet-EU

trans-unit.source: From your workstation, open Windows PowerShell ISE.
trans-unit.target: From your workstation, open Windows PowerShell ISE.

trans-unit.source: Set the variables at the beginning of the script, and then run the script.
trans-unit.target: Set the variables at the beginning of the script, and then run the script.

trans-unit.source: To provision an HBase Cluster in Contoso-VNet-US
trans-unit.target: To provision an HBase Cluster in Contoso-VNet-US

trans-unit.source: Use the same script with the following values:
trans-unit.target: Use the same script with the following values:

trans-unit.source: Because you have already connected to your Azure account, you don't need to run the following comlets anymore:
trans-unit.target: Because you have already connected to your Azure account, you don't need to run the following comlets anymore:

trans-unit.source: In <linkText>Configure DNS for the virtual networks[hdinsight-hbase-replication-dns]</linkText><title></title>, you have configured DNS servers for the two networks.
trans-unit.target: In <linkText>Configure DNS for the virtual networks[hdinsight-hbase-replication-dns]</linkText><title></title>, you have configured DNS servers for the two networks.

trans-unit.source: The HBase clusters have different domain suffixes.
trans-unit.target: The HBase clusters have different domain suffixes.

trans-unit.source: So you need to configure additional DNS conditional forwarders.
trans-unit.target: So you need to configure additional DNS conditional forwarders.

trans-unit.source: To configure conditional forwarder, you need to know the domain suffixes of the two HBase clusters.
trans-unit.target: To configure conditional forwarder, you need to know the domain suffixes of the two HBase clusters.

trans-unit.source: To find the domain suffixes of the two HBase clusters
trans-unit.target: To find the domain suffixes of the two HBase clusters

trans-unit.source: RDP into Contoso-HBase-EU.
trans-unit.target: RDP into Contoso-HBase-EU.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see <linkText>Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight by using the Azure portal[hdinsight-manage-portal]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see <linkText>Manage Hadoop clusters in HDInsight by using the Azure portal[hdinsight-manage-portal]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: It is actually headnode0 of the cluster.
trans-unit.target: It is actually headnode0 of the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Open a Windows PowerShell console, or a command prompt.
trans-unit.target: Open a Windows PowerShell console, or a command prompt.

trans-unit.source: Run ipconfig, and write down Connection-specific DNS suffix.
trans-unit.target: Run ipconfig, and write down Connection-specific DNS suffix.

trans-unit.source: Please don't close the RDP session.
trans-unit.target: Please don't close the RDP session.

trans-unit.source: You will need it later to test domain name resolution.
trans-unit.target: You will need it later to test domain name resolution.

trans-unit.source: Repeat the same steps to find out the Connection-specific DNS suffix of Contoso-HBase-US.
trans-unit.target: Repeat the same steps to find out the Connection-specific DNS suffix of Contoso-HBase-US.

trans-unit.source: To configure DNS forwarders
trans-unit.target: To configure DNS forwarders

trans-unit.source: RDP into Contoso-DNS-EU.
trans-unit.target: RDP into Contoso-DNS-EU.

trans-unit.source: Click the Windows key on the lower left.
trans-unit.target: Click the Windows key on the lower left.

trans-unit.source: Click Administrative Tools.
trans-unit.target: Click Administrative Tools.

trans-unit.source: Click DNS.
trans-unit.target: Click DNS.

trans-unit.source: In the left pane, expand DSN, Contoso-DNS-EU.
trans-unit.target: In the left pane, expand DSN, Contoso-DNS-EU.

trans-unit.source: Right-click Conditional Forwarders, and then click New Conditional Forwarder.
trans-unit.target: Right-click Conditional Forwarders, and then click New Conditional Forwarder.

trans-unit.source: Enter the following information:
trans-unit.target: Enter the following information:

trans-unit.source: DNS Domain: enter the DNS suffix of the Contoso-HBase-US.
trans-unit.target: DNS Domain: enter the DNS suffix of the Contoso-HBase-US.

trans-unit.source: For example: Contoso-HBase-US.f5.internal.cloudapp.net.
trans-unit.target: For example: Contoso-HBase-US.f5.internal.cloudapp.net.

trans-unit.source: IP addresses of the master servers: enter 10.2.0.4, which is the Contoso-DNS-US’s IP address.
trans-unit.target: IP addresses of the master servers: enter 10.2.0.4, which is the Contoso-DNS-US’s IP address.

trans-unit.source: Please verify the IP.
trans-unit.target: Please verify the IP.

trans-unit.source: Your DNS server can have a different IP address.
trans-unit.target: Your DNS server can have a different IP address.

trans-unit.source: Press ENTER, and then click OK.
trans-unit.target: Press ENTER, and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: Now you will be able to resolve the Contoso-DNS-US’s IP address from Contoso-DNS-EU.
trans-unit.target: Now you will be able to resolve the Contoso-DNS-US’s IP address from Contoso-DNS-EU.

trans-unit.source: Repeat the steps to add a DNS conditional forwarder to the DNS service on the Contoso-DNS-US virtual machine with the following values:
trans-unit.target: Repeat the steps to add a DNS conditional forwarder to the DNS service on the Contoso-DNS-US virtual machine with the following values:

trans-unit.source: DNS Domain: enter the DNS suffix of the Contoso-HBase-EU.
trans-unit.target: DNS Domain: enter the DNS suffix of the Contoso-HBase-EU.

trans-unit.source: IP addresses of the master servers: enter 10.2.0.4, which is the Contoso-DNS-EU’s IP address.
trans-unit.target: IP addresses of the master servers: enter 10.2.0.4, which is the Contoso-DNS-EU’s IP address.

trans-unit.source: To test domain name resolution
trans-unit.target: To test domain name resolution

trans-unit.source: Switch to the Contoso-HBase-EU RDP window.
trans-unit.target: Switch to the Contoso-HBase-EU RDP window.

trans-unit.source: Open a command prompt.
trans-unit.target: Open a command prompt.

trans-unit.source: Run the ping command:
trans-unit.target: Run the ping command:

trans-unit.source: The ICM protocol is turned on the worker nodes of the HBase clusters
trans-unit.target: The ICM protocol is turned on the worker nodes of the HBase clusters

trans-unit.source: Don't close the RDP session.
trans-unit.target: Don't close the RDP session.

trans-unit.source: You will still need it later in the tutorial.
trans-unit.target: You will still need it later in the tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Repeat the same steps to ping the headnode0 of the Contoso-HBase-EU from the Contoso-HBase-US.
trans-unit.target: Repeat the same steps to ping the headnode0 of the Contoso-HBase-EU from the Contoso-HBase-US.

trans-unit.source: DNS must work before you can proceed to the next steps.
trans-unit.target: DNS must work before you can proceed to the next steps.

trans-unit.source: Now, you can create a sample HBase table, enable replication, and then test it with some data.
trans-unit.target: Now, you can create a sample HBase table, enable replication, and then test it with some data.

trans-unit.source: The sample table you will use has two column families: Personal and Office.
trans-unit.target: The sample table you will use has two column families: Personal and Office.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will make the Europe HBase cluster as the source cluster, and the U.S. HBase cluster as the destination cluster.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will make the Europe HBase cluster as the source cluster, and the U.S. HBase cluster as the destination cluster.

trans-unit.source: Create HBase tables with the same names and column families on both the source and destination clusters, so that the destination cluster knows where to store data it will receive.
trans-unit.target: Create HBase tables with the same names and column families on both the source and destination clusters, so that the destination cluster knows where to store data it will receive.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using the HBase shell, see <linkText>Get started with Apache HBase in HDInsight[hdinsight-hbase-get-started]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on using the HBase shell, see <linkText>Get started with Apache HBase in HDInsight[hdinsight-hbase-get-started]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To create an HBase table on Contoso-HBase-EU
trans-unit.target: To create an HBase table on Contoso-HBase-EU

trans-unit.source: Switch to the Contoso-HBase-EU RDP window.
trans-unit.target: Switch to the Contoso-HBase-EU RDP window.

trans-unit.source: From the desktop, click Hadoop Command Line.
trans-unit.target: From the desktop, click Hadoop Command Line.

trans-unit.source: Change the folder to the HBase home directory:
trans-unit.target: Change the folder to the HBase home directory:

trans-unit.source: Open the HBase shell:
trans-unit.target: Open the HBase shell:

trans-unit.source: Create an HBase table:
trans-unit.target: Create an HBase table:

trans-unit.source: Don't close either the RDP session nor the Hadoop Command Line window.
trans-unit.target: Don't close either the RDP session nor the Hadoop Command Line window.

trans-unit.source: You will still need them later in the tutorial.
trans-unit.target: You will still need them later in the tutorial.

trans-unit.source: To create an HBase table on Contoso-HBase-US
trans-unit.target: To create an HBase table on Contoso-HBase-US

trans-unit.source: Repeat the same steps to create the same table on Contoso-HBase-US.
trans-unit.target: Repeat the same steps to create the same table on Contoso-HBase-US.

trans-unit.source: To add Contoso-HBase-US as a replication peer
trans-unit.target: To add Contoso-HBase-US as a replication peer

trans-unit.source: Switch to the Contso-HBase_EU RDP window.
trans-unit.target: Switch to the Contso-HBase_EU RDP window.

trans-unit.source: From the HBase shell window, add the destination cluster (Contoso-HBase-US) as a peer, for example:
trans-unit.target: From the HBase shell window, add the destination cluster (Contoso-HBase-US) as a peer, for example:

trans-unit.source: In the sample, the domain suffix is contoso-hbase-us.d4.internal.cloudapp.net.
trans-unit.target: In the sample, the domain suffix is contoso-hbase-us.d4.internal.cloudapp.net.

trans-unit.source: You need to update it to match your domain suffix of the US HBase cluster.
trans-unit.target: You need to update it to match your domain suffix of the US HBase cluster.

trans-unit.source: Make sure there is no spaces between the hostnames.
trans-unit.target: Make sure there is no spaces between the hostnames.

trans-unit.source: To configure each column family to be replicated on the source cluster
trans-unit.target: To configure each column family to be replicated on the source cluster

trans-unit.source: From the HBase shell window of the Contso-HBase-EU RDP session, configure each column family to be replicated:
trans-unit.target: From the HBase shell window of the Contso-HBase-EU RDP session, configure each column family to be replicated:

trans-unit.target: To bulk upload data to the HBase table

trans-unit.target: A sample data file has been uploaded to a public Azure Blob container with the following URL:

trans-unit.target: You can upload the same data file into your HBase cluster and import the data from there.

trans-unit.target: Switch to the Contoso-HBase-EU RDP window.

trans-unit.target: From the desktop, click Hadoop Command Line.

trans-unit.source: Change the folder to the HBase home directory:
trans-unit.target: Change the folder to the HBase home directory:

trans-unit.target: You can verify that replication is taking place by scanning the tables from both clusters with the following HBase shell commands:
